channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Looking to lower your energy bills this winter? How about hosting a data center in your garden shed to help heat your home
item.description: An Essex couple heats their home using a shed-based HeatHub with 500 Raspberry Pi computers, cutting electricity bills dramatically.

item.title: The Verge’s 2025 holiday gift guide
item.description: The holidays have a way of sneaking up on us. One minute you're trick-or-treating with your kids, and the next you're panic shopping in a Buc-ee's gift aisle. But it doesn't have to be that way. With the right cheat sheet, you can keep the holiday spirit high and stress levels low. Fortunately, we did […]

item.title: New Book Claims RFK Jr. Admitted to Doing Psychedelic Drug DMT, Said Brain Worm Wasn’t Actually a Worm
item.description: Kennedy hasn't publicly commented on the claims.

item.title: 7 ways ChatGPT can help you plan a party
item.description: ChatGPT is the event planner you’ve always dreamed of, but free, and in your pocket whenever you need it

item.title: I’m out of reasons to recommend Apple’s M1 MacBook Air, even at $600
item.description: This is just a little public service announcement ahead of Black Friday. Walmart will once again tout the M1 MacBook Air as an unbeatable deal for laptop shoppers. It sure is tempting at $599, especially if you haven’t seen the deal before. It might even be the right choice for some people. But for most […]

item.title: Paru Itagaki’s ‘Sanda’ Is the Kind Of Weird That Actually Means Something
item.description: Science Saru's anime adaptation of 'Beastars' creator's Santa Claus-centric murder mystery proves Itagaki remains consistently good at getting weird, getting deep, and not backing down.

item.title: VC Jennifer Neundorfer explains how founders can stand out in a crowded AI market
item.description: Founders and investors alike are obsessed with AI, and even Neundorfer said her firm, January Ventures, is looking at ways to use AI to make their work more efficient, such as helping to do due diligence on the market and competition.

item.title: Function Health raises $298M Series B at $2.5B valuation
item.description: Function, which offers blood testing and medical imaging services, recently raised $298 million in a Series B round led by Redpoint Ventures at a valuation of $2.5 billion.

item.title: This Excellent LG OLED Is Deeply Discounted Before Black Friday
item.description: With premium black levels and accurate colors, the LG B5 is a great entry point to OLED screens.

item.title: The 53 Best Deals From REI’s 2025 Holiday Sale
item.description: The company that wants you to #optoutside for Black Friday is having its sale early. Gear up for next year with these great deals on packs, sleeping bags, merino wool, and more.

item.title: Elon Musk Claims Money Won’t Exist in the Future (and Jensen Huang Would Like a Heads Up)
item.description: "My prediction is that work will be optional," Musk said about the future.

item.title: Mars : les scientifiques se réunissent à Paris pour décider de ce qui pourrait enfin rendre une mission habitée possible
item.description: Dans un contexte où des États envisagent de s'installer durablement sur la Lune et à explorer Mars, le 25e Congrès des Mars Societies Européennes se tiendra à Paris les 28 et 29 novembre. Cet événement incontournable réunira des experts internationaux et des représentants des sections...

item.title: Samsung's Galaxy Z Fold 7 gets a jaw-dropping $700 discount for Black Friday – and that’s not even the best part
item.description: Samsung just smashed the best-ever Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 deal, and I can't believe my eyes.

item.title: Labor Department cancels full October jobs report due to the federal shutdown
item.description: Instead, it will release some of the October jobs data along with the full November jobs report, now due a couple of weeks late on Dec. 16. The Labor Department said Wednesday that it will not be releasing a full jobs report for October because the 43-day federal government shutdown meant it couldn’t calculate the unemployment rate and some other key numbers....

item.title: Spotify acquires music database WhoSampled
item.description: WhoSampled offers an extensive database of songs, samples, covers, remixes, artists, and more. According to its website, it's now tracking more than 1.2 million songs and nearly 622,000 samples. That data is powering Spotify's latest features, like its upcoming music discovery tool SongDNA.

item.title: Warner Music settles copyright lawsuit with Udio, signs deal for AI music platform
item.description: The subscription service will allow users to make remixes, covers, and new songs using the voices of artists and compositions of songwriters who choose to participate.

item.title: Webb Captures a Stunning Cosmic Structure We’ve Never Seen Before
item.description: The aging pair of stars swing by one another once every 190 years, producing four spirals of dust.

item.title: Drone maker lets robot fly drone to prove it's easy to use and scare the heck out of us
item.description: G1 robot controls Antigravity A1

item.title: AI agents are about to change how you shop—here’s what that means
item.description: By year’s end, more than half of consumers will use artificial intelligence agents for commerce. Fetch is betting it can make the experience seamless—and safe. Agentic artificial intelligence is coming, whether you’re ready for it or not. A PwC survey published earlier this year found that 88% of U.S. companies are beefing up their agentic AI budgets, and a broad majority have adopted AI agents in some capacity. ...

item.title: A decades-old threat command is making a comeback - so don't let the "finger" of doom affect you
item.description: A legacy network command resurfaces in malicious campaigns, exploiting users to execute hidden Python programs and steal data.

item.title: 40 Best Early Black Friday Deals on WIRED-Tested Gear (2025)
item.description: We found early Black Friday deals on WIRED-tested smart bird feeders, smartwatches, vacuums, and more.

item.title: WhatsApp : 3,5 milliards de numéros de téléphone récupérés via une faille de sécurité
item.description: 3,5 milliards de comptes WhatsApp scannés en quelques semaines. C'est l'exploit qu'ont réalisé des chercheurs autrichiens en détournant la fonction de découverte de contacts. Ils ont pu interroger 100 millions de numéros par heure et cartographier l'ensemble des utilisateurs actifs dans 245 pays. Meta a remercié les chercheurs et colmaté la brèche. Mais le fond du problème reste entier. ...

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI Is Getting a Fancy 500-Megawatt Data Center in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Musk and the Kingdom worked together to buy Twitter, so they already have a nice relationship.

item.title: The best Bluetooth trackers for Apple and Android phones
item.description: Editor’s note: Black Friday doesn’t officially take place until Friday, November 28th; however, if you want to shop ahead of time, we’ve rounded up the best early Black Friday deals you can already get. Some people rarely lose things. Wallets are always exactly where they’re supposed to be, keys never go missing, and remotes never slip between the […]...
